page.title: 18VECHILE SURVEY
page.content:
A survey was carried out in July 1985 on cars in our area. We found there was a total of 98 vehicles. Of these 58 were British, 13 Japanese, 13 German, 8 Italian, 4 French and 2 Swedish. There were also 4 vans. We visited 80% of the houses and farms and found that out of these, 6 houses did not own a car or other vehicle of any kind. This means that for approximately every 16 houses, 1 house does not own a car. We (the children in school) were pleased to find in this area most people buy British cars. A thrice daily bus service runs from Derby via Long Lane to Longford.
DAVID WOOLER White Cottage, Dalbury Lees.
